description: {"blocks":[{"key":"179eb","text":"The fluorescent gelatin degradation assay is a method to study cell invasion by detecting gelatinase activity in vitro upon epifluorescence microscopy analysis. In this protocol, the method has been applied to evaluate the effect of hypoxic EVs from TNBC cell line MDA-MB-231 in four cellular models for the tumor microenvironment - MDA-MB-231 (tumor cell), HUVEC (endothelial cell), HDFa (dermal fibroblast) and THP-1 (monocyte). Adapted from Pachane et al (2022) (PMID: 36293503).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":110,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"av0om","text":"Using the microscope ImageXpress Micro XLS+ (Molecular Devices), check the template for the Corning 3603 plate and the filters for DAPI (nuclei), FITC (gelatin) and Cy5 (phalloidin-647).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":20,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eb6u2","text":"Change into the 20x objective and adjust the laser focus. Select 9 sites per well minimally.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f6ndk","text":"Acquire the plate. Export metadata for analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"439j2","text":"Images should already be scaled. If not, adjust scale based on the objective lens used for acquisition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ksvb","text":"Set measurements to contain \"Area\", \"Standard Deviation\", \"Shape Descriptor\", \"Mean grey value\", \"Perimeter\" and \"Display label\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e90kq","text":"Concatenate all stacks into a single hyperstack.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bvbbm","text":"Split channels and select the FITC stack for analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4aut8","text":"Set a threshold to encompass the degradation spots but not the background. Write down the threshold values. Create a new stack with the binary images. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"av7fl","text":"To measure the degraded area, analyze particles with a range of \"5-Infinity\" and select \"Summarize\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"akgau","text":"Save CSV file. The degraded area (in µm2) per site will be compared between groups in the statistical analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":39,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmi8p","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7FB2C2021C7E489889C014E63140621E","step_guid":"3458C7B354A844C6915A5FD879E41D17","title":"and follow through step #27"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ablq5","text":"Split channels and select the DAPI stack for counting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ek5dv","text":"Set a threshold to contain nuclei. Create a new stack with the binary images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6kh2","text":"To count cells, analyze particles with a range of \"10-infinity\" and select \"Summarize\". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"25pv8","text":"Save CSV file. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1cq34","text":"Split channels and select the Cy5 stack for analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmi8p","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7FB2C2021C7E489889C014E63140621E","step_guid":"3458C7B354A844C6915A5FD879E41D17","title":"and follow through step #27"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2d042","text":"Duplicate the stack as a guide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6e02h","text":"Set a threshold to encompass cell cytoplasm. Create a new stack with the binary images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2k7r7","text":"Using the duplicated stack as a guide, section cells using the \"pencil\" tool with a 3 px thickness.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"282mt","text":"To analyze cell morphology, analyze particles with a range of \"10-Infinity\" and check \"Clear Results\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vpm5","text":"Save CSV file. The cell circularity index of each cell will be compared between groups in the statistical analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c23fv","text":"Select the cell of interest in a 200x200 px squared selection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmi8p","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7FB2C2021C7E489889C014E63140621E","step_guid":"3458C7B354A844C6915A5FD879E41D17","title":"and follow through step #27"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1u3ud","text":"Split the channels of the stacks of interest.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2eh0t","text":"Adjust channel colors using the \"Lookup Tables\" menu.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ak6v7","text":"Save selections in each channel and the combination of all channels in PNG images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5b3ri","text":"Treat cells with EVh (109 particles/ml) or the equivalent treatment volume in PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":24,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv2ml","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Fluorescent Gelatin Degradation Assay to Evaluate EVh Action in TME Cells
